§6§lFrom objects to diagrams for ranges of functors§r

§8§oPierre Gillibert
Friedrich Wehrung§r

§72011§r

Comments: \u00a77\u00a7oVersion 1: 135 pages. Remarks for that version: (1) The comment at the beginning of Section 3-6 (that if (k,l) arrows Q and P embeds into Q, then (k,l) arrows P) is easily seen to be valid in case Q is lower finite,

unknown otherwise. Therest of the paper is notaffected by this oversight. (2) In the statement of Problem 5, the functor \u0393should go from semilattices and their embeddings tosurjective V-measures. (3) References [18] and [63] are to
appear (Combinatorica and Adv. in Appl. Math., respectively). To appear as Springer Lecture Notes in Mathematics, Volume 2029. Version 2 (165 pages) is the one sent to the publisher\u00a7r
